extends SyncHook

Serialized Form

Field Summary
private  boolean addOnce
          Remembers the mode of the Hook
private  java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue
          The queue of QueueHooks, in which this Hook will be added by calling signal()
private  boolean signalled
          Remembers the call of signal.
 
Fields inherited from class cz.ive.messaging.SyncHook
listeners
 
Constructor Summary
QueueHook()
          Creates a new instance of QueueHook without set properties Until you assign a queue using changeQueue(), it will behave as a SyncHook
QueueHook(java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue, boolean addOnce)
          Creates a new instance of QueueHook
 
Method Summary
 void changeQueue(java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue, boolean addOnce)
          Changes the queue of hooks, removes all references to this hook from the previous queue
 void processSignal()
          Removes one reference to this Hook from the queue and pulls legs of all registered listeners
protected  void signal()
          Adds a reference to this Hook to the queue To remove it from the queue use only unsignal() or processSignal() If the queue is null, immediately pulls legs of all registered listeners.
protected  void unsignal()
          Removes one reference to this Hook from the queue

Field Detail

queue

private java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue
The queue of QueueHooks, in which this Hook will be added by calling signal()

addOnce

private boolean addOnce
Remembers the mode of the Hook

signalled

private boolean signalled
Remembers the call of signal. Used only for addOnce Hooks to filter multiple signals

Constructor Detail

QueueHook

public QueueHook(java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue,
                 boolean addOnce)
Creates a new instance of QueueHook

Parameters:
queue - the queue of hooks
addOnce - mode of the Hook - add to the queue only by first signal or by each

QueueHook

public QueueHook()
Creates a new instance of QueueHook without set properties Until you assign a queue using changeQueue(), it will behave as a SyncHook

Method Detail

signal

protected void signal()
Adds a reference to this Hook to the queue To remove it from the queue use only unsignal() or processSignal() If the queue is null, immediately pulls legs of all registered listeners.

unsignal

protected void unsignal()
Removes one reference to this Hook from the queue

processSignal

public void processSignal()
Removes one reference to this Hook from the queue and pulls legs of all registered listeners

changeQueue

public void changeQueue(java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue,
                        boolean addOnce)
Changes the queue of hooks, removes all references to this hook from the previous queue

Parameters:
queue - the queue of hooks
addOnce - mode of the Hook - add to the queue only by first signal or by each
